alfredsnippet.snippet:
Hoyle, Burbidge & Narlikar, A Different Approach to Cosmology, p.312

"The third point which was originally made by Ambartsumian is that there is no good reason to believe that in all cases groups and clusters of galaxies are stable and bound ... Thus, a large part of the argument for the presence of much dark matter goes away, since it is based on the virial theorem."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Hoyle Suggests There Is No Good Reason to Believe that In All Cases Groups and Clusters of Galaxies Are Stable
